One unique aspect of West of Souls is that the exploration phase is a hybrid of non-linear narrative, card-based battle encounters, and dungeon crawling. In addition, all characters in play do not have to enter the same exploration together, allowing for multiple explorations to occur simultaneously. Within the exploration phase, players will be forced to make harrowing choices, complete skill checks, and defeat beast to move forward. Vital story elements, lore, and history will be revealed to the players as they progress through the game.
While death is an option in West of Souls, a player is never permanently removed from the game. The main resources in this epic journey are time and stress. If your team does not accomplish their goal within the allotted time frame, Eloria is cast into ruin. Likewise, if the encounters prove too much for your party and your stress level reaches a breaking point, you will lose the game. Victory is achieved at the end of each scenario as players defeat enemies of increasing difficultly and complete the necessary tasks.
This flagship game from Sky Monster Games is an ambitious story telling odyssey that maximizes the use of battle mechanics in combination with non-linear storytelling and character customization.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Wer hat gut gelernt?
boardgame.description:
The answer cards are evenly dealt among the players, which take turns to roll and move one lone pawn about the game board. When the pawn stops on a space the player reads the question printed on the space. The player who thinks he has the right answer card gives the answer. If the answer is right the player gest a commendation, if not he gets a rebuke. The game ends when the pawn reaches or passes the last space. The player with the most commendations wins the game. But for each rebuke six commendations are substracted

—user summary.

boardgame.name: 間違いさがし開発課 (Machigaisa Ga Shi Kaihatsuka)
boardgame.description:
In 間違いさがし開発課 (Machigaisa Ga Shi Kaihatsuka), roughly "Mistake Search and Development Division", the players are drawing differences on copies of photos, and the other players are trying to spot the differences.

The players have 2 minutes to draw the differences, and the other players have 3 minutes to spot them. The drawer is rewarded if the other players find the guess between 1 and 3 minutes, or if large additions go unnoticed.

The player with the most points after each has had a chance to draw wins.

boardgame.name: Potion Permit
boardgame.description:
The town of Moonbury has always been wary of the advances of the outside world, preferring to rely on their traditional methods of healing. Until one day, when the mayor's daughter falls ill, and the local witch doctor can do nothing to help her, they are forced to look outside their small community for help.

The Medical Association decides to send their most accomplished chemist - you - to help cure the mayor's daughter and convince the residents of Moonbury of the wonders of modern alchemy. Gain their trust and tend to each person when they fall ill in this open-ended sim RPG.

boardgame.name: Roll & Write Railroads
boardgame.description:
In Roll & Write Railroads, the players are new employees of a railroad company, having just left their families' bean farms. They were so good at running the bean farm, they were put in charge of all of the railroad projects. However, they have no knowledge of railroads! So they made a die out of a soybean their parents entrusted them with, and leave their fate up to it.

On a turn, a player rolls one more dice than the number of players. Then, in clockwise order, each player selects a die. The players then take an action based upon the die number. The actions involve laying track, building stations, and possibly gaining money. Later, players may unlock ways to enhance these actions.

Players may only build from left to right, and only on train lines they have opened.

After each player finishes their actions, they each take a second action with the unselected die. Then, the players score points based upon how far their stations have been built on each line.

After ten rounds, players sum their intermediate scores and also earn points for how many of their actions they enhanced. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: The God Game
boardgame.description:
The description on the box says "PLAY GOD!!! Start your own religion! Persecute non-believers! Send followers to heaven! Riotous spoof and FUN for 12 YEARS and older."

It plays like Sorry! with a few twists and turns.

It has a National Lampoon vibe. Adult themes. Irreverent. Edgy.

It was made by the American Publishing Corporation in Waltham, Massachusetts. This famous company no longer exists, but its infamous products live on. They made drug and sex themed board games, puzzles in cans (including Playboy centerfold puzzles), and politically incorrect books about how to fish, how to ski, and how to play golf. For example, one of their games is "LSD Ludicrous Systems Development: A Psychedelic Happening Construction Kit."

—user summary

boardgame.name: Patty Stack
boardgame.description:
Whip out the spatulas and get to the grill! In Patty Stack, your goal is to construct the most delicious hamburger. You’ll score points for well-played cards, but be careful – you’ll lose points for any card you can’t play! Build your burger and then eat your hard work to find out how you stack up against the competition. It’s medium rare to find a game this well done.

Patty Stack is a dice-drafting and card placement game. On your turn, you will select a dice from the table and place a patty card on your patty stack that matches your die value. You can never stack two cards next to each other with matching values or matching toppings. You will score points for the cards you successfully stack, and will have a point deducted for cards you are unable to stack successfully. You spend the game stacking your patties, and then "eat your burger" to determine your final score.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Brazil: Imperial – Autômato
boardgame.description:
Challenge an artificially simulated player!

Get ready for a new challenge in Brazil: Imperial. The Autômato is an implacable adversary that will put all his experience as the leader of his nation to the test.

It is possible to use the Autômato in solo matches or add it to maps with more players, which helps to create a new gameplay, with an unpredictable opponent that does not accept negotiation!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Escape the Minotaur's Maze
boardgame.description:
A competitive fast-paced dungeon crawling game for two to four players. Game plays in 30-45 minutes.

Each game begins with a maze generated from randomly drawn dungeon cards. The players take turns exploring and moving through the maze. They can play cards from their hand to replace explored tiles to make it easier for them to escape or hinder the competing players.

The first to recover the magical Chalice and escape is the winner.

Play one of four different characters with unique attack and defense abilities to help you survive the minotaur’s fury.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Bacon
boardgame.description:
Bacon is a fixed-partnerships climbing game for 4 or 6 players that is all about going out early as a team. The only team that will score is the team that goes out first, but their score will depend on when the rest of the team goes out. If your team does NOT go out first, your job is simple: make the other team go out as late as possible.

The rules also include the Applewood variant for 3 to 6 players: this is the no-partnerships version of Bacon. There are no teams; it’s every person for themselves. Your score will depend solely on the position you go out so go out early.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Daiquiri
boardgame.description:
Daiquiri is a middle-weight domino climbing game for 3 or 4 players.

You will need 3 or 4 sets of double-six dominoes depending on the number of players.

There are no teams; it’s every person for themselves. Your score will depend solely on the position you go out so go out early.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Fiddich
boardgame.description:
Fiddich is a heavy-weight climbing game that uses 4 sets of double six dominoes and is played by strictly 4 players in fixed partnerships, 2 vs 2.

Each player is given a set of 7 blank tiles (their Glen). These tiles can be used to form ordinary combinations and they can be used to form bombs. They offer flexibility and power. Everyone has them. Use yours wisely.

Your goal is to shed 28 tiles (including your Glen).

The game is all about going out early as a team. The only team that will score is the team that goes out first, but their score will depend on when the rest of the team goes out. If your team does NOT go out first, your job is simple: make the other team go out as late as possible.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Soll + Haben mit Schlau & Lau
boardgame.description:
Both players get the same starting capital and agree on a fixed playing time. Each player gets one meeple and both start at the same starting space. Movement is like a rock in chess, any number of spaces in any orthogonal direction. Each space allows for a business transaction and the players use double entry bookkeeping to manage the ballace of their business portfolio.
At the end of the game the player with the highest profit wins the game.

The game was most likely published in the early 60s.

boardgame.name: Monsters on Board: Plastic Fearmobiles
boardgame.description: Fearmobiles are plastic upgrades inspired by their cardboard versions from the base game. All 4 Fearmobiles have a unique design.

boardgame.name: Hawker Wars
boardgame.description:
A mouth-watering party game that lets you compete to cook some of the most iconic hawker dishes in Singapore.

Each player owns a hawker stall. On every player's turn, the player draws two ingredient cards and one action card. Then they take up to two of the following actions: (a) COOK: Cook a dish by matching the ingredients on hand with ingredients on the Dish card. Each dish is worth a certain number of points, (b) ACTION: Play an action card, or (c) TRADE: Trade 2 ingredients on hand with 1 ingredient from the Black Market

The first player that reaches the target number of points wins.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: What Lies Beneath
boardgame.description:
Winner:
2nd best overall game in the BGG 9 Card Nano Game contest.

Synopsis:
You dream you’re in an old church. The familiar scent of thick stone walls and incense penetrates your sleep. A sense of unease washes through you. The comforting smell is just a veil. The core is much more macabre. A graveyard. Dust, bones, and dried death. You awake in the darkness. You’re underground. It must be some kind of crypt. Your surroundings are unfamiliar and you have no recollection of how you got there. In fact, you remember nothing. Not even your own name. A torch flickers on the other side of some rusty iron bars. You wait. Listening for sounds, watching for movement, anything to provide answers. Nothing. No one. Your eyes have grown accustomed to the limited light. The cell is small. You crawl over to the bars and find the door is unlocked. You listen. To avoid making a noise, you squeeze around the entrance. A breeze in the corridor brings the stench of rot. You gag. Still, a breeze means you’re not sealed in. There is a way out. You take the torch, determined to get out of here alive.

The game is played in two chapters. Each chapter contains a number of Encounters that you must overcome to reach safety outside of the Crypt walls. This is done in a style similar to choosing your own path. Chapter 1 takes place within the Crypt where you will face three Encounters. Chapter 2 takes place in the Mystic Forest and it also contains 3 Encounters. At the end of Chapter 2, you will encounter one of two bosses. The game contains a variety of endings depending on the difficulty chosen as well as your final score.

The game is a simple and quick solo dungeon crawler with elements of re-rolling and locking dice to complete sequences. The game also contains elements of role-playing as well as item management. The length of the game is 15+ minutes and is suited for ages 12 and up.

boardgame.name: Escape the Lich King
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Flee is a cooperative 20 card game of Dungeon escape through discovery and attack. A party of three stalwart adventures have overestimated their worth while exploring the nearest dungeon and find themselves desperate to escape alive.

Pursued by hordes of monsters and the Big Boss, the party must find their lost weapons while fending off the horde. To escape the dungeon, they must each find one of three potions that will help teleport them out of the dungeon. If enough monsters set on the trail of the party, they notify the Big Boss who moves in for the final attack to stop them from escaping.

If the party can fend off the monsters while fleeing the dungeon and all drink the three potions together, they can escape the dungeon with their lives.

Player Win conditions:
The three players win if they each have a character card, a matching weapon card and a potion card showing. Then all three players will drink from their potions during the Cleanup Phase to teleport out of the dungeon and win the game.

Big Boss win conditions:
If the total value of all revealed monsters is greater than 10 at the end of the Battle Phase, the players lose and the Big Boss player wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Catan: Hexatower
boardgame.description:
This is an official Catan Accessory by Gamegenic. It's a hex-shaped 2-in-1 dice storage and dice tower and is available in red or yellow.


Officially licensed product
2-in-1: Premium dice tower and dice storage box
Unique: Compact dice tower in the classic CATAN® hexagonal shape
Removable closing flap converts into a dice-stopper
2 inner ramps roll the dice steadily
Inner material provides a pleasant dice-rolling sound
Powerful magnets for a precise and secure self-closing seal
Elegant hot-stamped CATAN® logos
Premium materials (Nexofyber surface + silver fabric inner lining)

boardgame.name: Cyberpunk 2077: Gangs of Night City – Families and Outcasts
boardgame.description:
The Families and Outcasts expansion adds the 7th district, the Badlands, to the board — a new region for exploration during the game. It also brings 1 brand-new story and 2 more gangs to the game, the Aldecaldos and the Wraiths, also increasing the game's maximum player count to 5!

The Badlands district board is a 4-fold game board that is attached to the bottom right corner of Night City, mirroring the geography of the Cyberpunk 2077 in-game location.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Narcopolis
boardgame.description:
Narcopolis is an immersive and competitive Board Game. The Game is play in the South of United States during the years 2000.

The Goal? Become the new boss of the town. To become the new Boss, you have to be the one with the higher rate of reputation at the end of the Game. The Game finish either when someone arrive to 20 points of reputation or after 10 turns.

There are 3 types of winning reputation:
1/ Doing some Jobs (missions)
2/ Play some influence Cards (Fight Club, Mob, Hired a Hitman…)
3/ Finance electoral campaign

To do that you have to earn money. There are 3 types of Winning it:

1/ Develope Business
2/ Play some influence Cards (Fight Club, Mob, Hired a Hitman…)
3/ The Humiliation (Sales reputation’s points)

Each turn every player have to play 2 obligatory actions (take money and move) and can do 5 more actions (play or buy influence card, do or exchange job, develope new Business, conquer a new area by fighting or just Build up new Business, Buy or sale reputation point).

To take territories to an enemy you have to play a dice fight which include a bluffing part. Even when you are unlucky you can be victorious.

Every table turn the first player revel a new event card which change, during a tour, a norm of the game.

It's a tactic Game with bluff and you have to be diplomatic and play dirty. Players light on the interactions and the fun around the table.

-description from writer

boardgame.name: 1775: Rebellion - Southern Theatre Scenario
boardgame.description:
User Summary

British forces have taken control of Savannah and Charles Town and thereby scattering the area's American Continental army.

The rest of the American forces chase out the Native Americans of Tennessee

And the British Regulars and Hessians lead by Cornwallis sweeps through Virginia waiting for the final command to take Yorktown.

Meanwhile Marquis de Lafayette's troops are assisting the Americans in Virginia to hold off the British until the French fleet will arrive...

All this and more happened in 1781.

boardgame.name: Stripper Anya: Christmas Special
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Demonica has stolen Christmas - and it is up to you, Anya, to get it back!

boardgame.name: Casting Shadows: Exclusive Edition
boardgame.description:
The Kickstarter Exclusive Edition comes with:

Casting Shadows Base Game in Kickstarter Exclusive Edition Box with magnetic box upgrade
4 Kickstarter Exclusive Companions (Vital Shroom; Dark Flutter; Lil' Shadow; Hammerhead Harvester)
3 Kickstarter Exclusive Resource cards (Purple Orb; 2 Shadow Fragment; Purple Gem)
2 Kickstarter Exclusive Player Boards (Iris Papillon / Iris The Obscure; Tusk Swiftwave / Tusk The Tidemaster)
3 Kickstarter Exclusive Attack Spells (Coral Katana; Venomous Strike; Warp Drop)
2 Kickstarter Exclusive Conversion Spells (Gem Alchemy; Orb Alchemy)
1 Kickstarter Exclusive Dice Tower
3 Kickstarter Exclusive Counterspells (Worst Curse; Unexpected Attack; Fly Away!)
3 Kickstarter Exclusive Hex Tiles (Glimmering Woods; Coral Ridge; Crystal Crypt)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Casting Shadows: Lucky Skipper / Lucky the Unstable Player Board
Casting Shadows: The Ice Storm Expansion

boardgame.name: Slappy Ass
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Just slap, grab, drag and strip that ass!
Do well and you get minigames to unlock more items and styles.


Slappy Ass is a sensual simulation spanking game where you play with a customizable booty. From old-fashioned hand spanking to futuristic sci-fi massaging and everything in-between. The more you experiment, the more exotic toys, panties and shapes you’ll grab your hands on. Challenge yourself with minigames. Test your rhythm, skill and endurance to achieve new unlockables.

Source: The Game Website.

-
boardgame.videogameversion: Android | Windows | Macintosh | Linux downloadable edition

boardgame.name: Meeple Detective
boardgame.description:
Meeple Detective is a deduction game that players must compete with other players to trace and apprehend Phantom and his minions.

The game have 2 PHASES :

ACTION PHASE
1. Each player must flip 1 card face up permanently and peek adjacent 1 card.

2.Check what type of card the player has last faced up.
2.1 If a face up card is a hostage room card or the clue room card : Nothing happened then next player will continue to play.
2.2 If a face up card is an event room card, active player must draw 1 time card and check what type of card opened is:
> investigate : Enter the investigative phase.
> empty room : Nothing happened then next player will continue to play.

INVESTIGATION PHASE
1. Starting from active player. Each player may place their Meeple (s) on any room card or pass.
2. If you are a first player of that card, place 1 Meeple, if not, place 2 Meeples.
3. When it comes back to active player, INVESTIGATION PHASE end.

Game end immediately after complete investigation phase 4 times. Then, scoring begins. Player with the most points wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: NEKO-NIN exHeart 2 Love +PLUS
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Four short games with, one for each of the lovely NEKO-NIN characters, Yura, Tama, Ritsu, and Maya.

It is a stand alone game, but it is recommended to play the NEKO-NIN exHeart core series before, however it is not strictly necessary.

boardgame.name: Golem: Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
B1: Carry out the action of 1 available Rabbi tile.

B2: Move your Colems a total of 2 steps & move your marker up
the Study track I step & activate 1 Golem (lay it down).

B3: Activate all your Golems (either standing or laying) without laying them down OR carn 5 VP.

boardgame.name: Dragon Swarm
boardgame.description:
Lead your swarm to victory! Command dragons and take to the skies in epic, multiplayer battles. Team with friends, fight for territory, and earn achievements on the battlefield.

Dragon Swarm is a fast-paced, arcade strategy game that will keep you moving and thinking on your path to glory.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Hentai Girl Division
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Lead your fighter girls against the enemy forces to retake the freedome of your planet!

Apart from a shooter part, the game also includes a sex simulator part

boardgame.name: Travels in the Land of Glyph
boardgame.description:
This game uses the Glyph deck to simulate a story-telling, problem-solving experience with simple matching mechanics.

During gameplay, the player will resolve obstacles by matching them with cards that share the same minor suits and that make narrative sense. Items will be picked up and placed in an inventory; characters can be befriended and join the player for a while.

An attempt to recreate the feel of a classic computer graphic adventure game using only cards, relying on your imagination to do most of the work.

—description from the designer
